alert.note: Alert for Bastrop; Caldwell; Fayette; Guadalupe; Lee (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 24 at 1:38AM CST until January 24 at 10:00AM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following counties, Bastrop, Caldwell, De Witt, Fayette, Gonzales, Guadalupe, Karnes, Lavaca, Lee and Wilson. * WHEN...Until noon CST today. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Moderate to heavy rain is possible through this morning. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches with isolated amounts near 5 inches are possible. The Flood Watch may need to be extended into the afternoon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
